text:
Hey everyone, I want to use a cta for tracking if a card was displayed and clicked. A Vue app is rendering cards into and out of the DOM as filters are selected. The cta should track if a card is clicked without redirecting to the ctas url. Also the the view of the cta should be tracked anytime it is rendered into the dom.
I was thinking to use the embedded code to implement this. Do you have any ideas for a possible solution?
Thanks

Hey Fabian, thereâ€™s no way to use CTAs for analytics purposes without using their default routing behavior. I'd suggest looking into the custom behavioral event tracking API instead: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code>
^ Agreed - HubSpot's basic CTA features aren't very customizable outside the UI in the HubSpot web-application.
You need to have HubSpot Marketing Enterprise to use the Custom Behavioral Events though just an FYI

Thank you for your replies :tada:
I will propose a solution with custom behavioral events
